Key Arguments: The legislation assumes the government is the sole arbiter of truth, which is problematic.
Freedom of speech is a fundamental right that the bill threatens.
The government cannot objectively determine what is true or false given the vast amount of information available.
The bill could cause harm by censoring information that might later be proven true, as illustrated by the COVID-19 lab origin theory.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right of every Australian.
No government body has the wisdom or ability to sort out what is true and what isnâ€™t.
The bill is misguided and must be rejected.
